column4: I know  I asked this question earlier, but now that it is later in the day...I am trying to install 6.10 onto a new computer (Core 2 Duo 2.13, 2GB Ram (PC 4200), 16GB HD, INTEL MB) and get an error : "BusyBox v1.1.3 (Debian 1:1.1.3-2Ubuntu3)  Bult-in shell (ash)...  /bin/sh: can't access tty; job control turned off... (initramfs) prompt"  I get the same error when trying to check the CD.  I have been running the RAM test for 2+ hrs and there are no
yea you could try the cd integrity test
: CD Integrity test won't load either
this is a good sign for the possible corruption of your disc. download the iso again and burn it on a different one
